question_stem:
In the topic on regression, we fitted the following simple linear regression model to the concrete data: Y=β0+β1X+e Y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 X + e  where

YY: is the Flow, and
XX: is amount of Water in the mixture.

The confidence intervals for the coefficients are given as follows:
##                   2.5 %      97.5 %
## (Intercept) -85.0841046 -32.3709993
## Water         0.4164861   0.6824575
Which of the following null hypothesis would be rejected at the 5% significance level?
question_stem_html:
In the topic on regression, we fitted the following simple linear regression model to the concrete data: Y=β0+β1X+e Y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 X + e where

  • YY: is the Flow, and
  • XX: is amount of Water in the mixture.

The confidence intervals for the coefficients are given as follows:

##                   2.5 %      97.5 %

## Water         0.4164861   0.6824575

Which of the following null hypothesis would be rejected at the 5% significance level?

YY: is the Flow, and

items.part_stem_html:
In the topic on regression, we fitted the following simple linear regression model to the concrete data: Y=β0+β1X+e Y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 X + e where

  • YY: is the Flow, and
  • XX: is amount of Water in the mixture.

The confidence intervals for the coefficients are given as follows:

##                   2.5 %      97.5 %
## (Intercept) -85.0841046 -32.3709993
## Water         0.4164861   0.6824575

Which of the following null hypothesis would be rejected at the 5% significance level?
items.solution: Remember that a confidence interval denotes the set of values that would not be rejected in a hypothesis test.
items.solution_html: Remember that a confidence interval denotes the set of values that would not be rejected in a hypothesis test.
